books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.about: A novel by J.D. Salinger. The story of Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.about: A novel by Harper Lee. The story of racial injustice in the American South.
A dystopian novel by George Orwell. It explores the consequences of government surveillance.

books.about: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald. The story of Jay Gatsby and the American Dream.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.about: A novel by Jane Austen. A story of love, class, and reputation in early 19th-century England.

books.title: Brave New World
books.about: A dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley. It explores a futuristic society driven by technology.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.about: A novel by Herman Melville. The story of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to catch a giant white whale.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.about: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien. The prelude to The Lord of the Rings.

books.about: A dystopian novel by Suzanne Collins. It features a deadly competition.

books.about: A mystery thriller by Dan Brown. It follows a code-breaking investigation.

books.about: A post-apocalyptic novel by Cormac McCarthy. A father and son's journey to survival.

books.title: The Giver
books.about: A dystopian novel by Lois Lowry. The story of a world without pain.
